member.summary: Event raised when a HighRes timer expires.

member.summary: Returns the number of micro seconds since boot

member.summary: Create a High Resolution Timer. A maximum of 10 timers can be created.

member.summary: Start a one shot timer. Once the timer has expired the timer event will be fired.

member.name: T:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Logging
member.summary: Controls the logging output. By default the logging is LOG_LEVEL_NONE as the same port is used for the Visual Studio debug connection when connected via serial port.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Logging.LogLevel.LOG_LEVEL_ERROR
member.summary: Critical errors, software module can not recover on its own

member.name: F:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Logging.LogLevel.LOG_LEVEL_WARN
member.summary: Error conditions from which recovery measures have been taken

member.name: F:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Logging.LogLevel.LOG_LEVEL_INFO
member.summary: Information messages which describe normal flow of events

member.name: F:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Logging.LogLevel.LOG_LEVEL_DEBUG
member.summary: Extra information which is not necessary for normal use (values, pointers, sizes, etc).

member.name: F:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Logging.LogLevel.LOG_LEVEL_VERBOSE
member.summary: Bigger chunks of debugging information, or frequent messages which can potentially flood the output.

member.name: M:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Logging.SetLogLevel(System.String,nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Logging.LogLevel)
member.summary: Set overall logging level for specific tag, tag "*" equals all tags.

member.name: M:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Configuration.SetPinFunction(System.Int32,nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.DeviceFunction)
member.summary: Set the default function for a GPIO pin.
member.remarks: Allows gpio pins to be assigned a device function. For example setting the I2C1 data pin to use GPIO pin 17.
member.param: The pin number to set against function.
The device function to be assigned the pin.

member.name: M:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Configuration.GetFunctionPin(nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.DeviceFunction)
member.summary: Returns the current pin number used by a device function.
member.returns: The pin number used by device function. If value is -1 then pins is not assigned.

member.summary: I2S1 function Bit Clock. Used for general purpose read and write on the I2S bus.

member.summary: I2S1 function WS. Used if your have stereo.

member.summary: I2S1 function DATA_OUT. Used for output data typically on a speaker.

member.summary: I2S1 function MDATA_IN. Used for input data typically from a microphone.

member.summary: I2S2 function WS. Used if your have stereo.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.DeviceFunction.I2S2_MDATA_IN

member.name: M:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Sleep.EnableWakeupByTimer(System.TimeSpan)
member.param: Period after which wakeup occurs.

member.name: M:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Sleep.EnableWakeupByPin(nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Sleep.WakeupGpioPin,System.Int32)
member.summary: Enable wakeup using a gpio pin.
member.param: GPIO number used as wakeup source. Only pins that have RTC functionality can be used. 0,2,4,12->15,25->27,32->39
Analog threshold at or above which pin causes wake up, or zero if pin is not active for wakeup.

member.name: M:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Sleep.EnableWakeupByMultiPins(nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Sleep.WakeupGpioPin,nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Sleep.WakeupMode)
member.remarks: Only pins that are RTC connected.
member.param: Combination of pins that are enabled for wakeup.
Logical mode used for wakeup to occur.

member.name: M:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Sleep.EnableWakeupByTouchPad(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Byte)
member.param: A valid pad number to wake up the device.
If a valid pad number, will be used in comibation of the first pad number.
Threshold coefficient for automatic calibration. Percentage from 0 to 100. Default value is 80% seems to work in most cases.
member.remarks: See to understand which GPIO maps with which pad.

member.name: M:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Sleep.EnableWakeupByUart(nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Sleep.WakeUpPort,System.Int32)
member.param: The port to use, only COM1 and COM2 are supported. Pins MUST be properly configured for COM2 for this to work.
The number of changes in the RX pin to wakeup the ESP.

member.name: M:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Sleep.StartLightSleep
member.summary: Enter light sleep with the configured wakeup options.
member.returns: Returns ESP32 native error enumeration, ESP_ERR_INVALID_STATE if Wifi or BT is not stopped.

member.name: M:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Sleep.StartDeepSleep
member.summary: Enter deep sleep using configured wakeup sources.
member.remarks: After a call to this method the device enters deep sleep, a wakeup source will wake the device and the execution will start as if it was a reset. After this occurs the cause can be queried using . Keep in mind that the execution WILL NOT continue after the call to this method. This call never returns. If no wakeup sources are configured then the device enters an indefinite sleep.

member.name: M:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Sleep.GetWakeupCause
member.summary: Get the cause for waking up.

member.name: M:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Sleep.GetWakeupGpioPin
member.summary: Returns a combination of pins that caused the wakeup.
member.returns: Returns a combination of the pins that caused the wakeup.

member.name: M:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Sleep.GetWakeupTouchpad
member.summary: Get the Touchpad which caused the wakeup.
member.returns: Returns TouchPad number which caused the wakeup, else .

member.summary: Specific to S2/S3, the denoise capacitance used to denoise the touch pad.

member.name: P:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.DenoiseSetting.DenoiseCapacitance
member.summary: Gets or sets the denoise capacitance.

member.name: P:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.DenoiseSetting.DenoiseRange
member.summary: Gets or sets the denoise range.

member.name: P:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.Esp32FilterSetting.Period
member.summary: The period in milliseconds for the filtering.

member.name: T:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.FilterSettingDebounce
member.summary: Set debounce count, such as n. If the measured values continue to exceed the threshold for n+1 times, the touch sensor state changes. Range: 0 ~ 7

member.name: T:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.FilterSettingNoiseThreshold
member.summary: Noise threshold coefficient. Higher = More noise resistance. The actual noise should be less than (noise coefficient * touch threshold). Range: 0 ~ 3. The coefficient is 0: 4/8; 1: 3/8; 2: 2/8; 3: 1;

member.name: T:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.FilterSettingSmoothMode
member.summary: Filter settings for the smooth mode.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.FilterSettingSmoothMode.Iir2
member.summary: Filter the raw data. The coefficient is 2 (Typical value).

member.name: F:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.FilterSettingSmoothMode.Iir4
member.summary: Filter the raw data. The coefficient is 4.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.FilterSettingSmoothMode.Iir8
member.summary: Filter the raw data. The coefficient is 8.

member.name: T:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.IFilterSetting
member.summary: Interface for the filtering configuration, they are different on the ESP32 and the S2/S3 series.

member.name: P:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.MeasurementTime.SleepCycles
member.summary: The timer frequency is RTC_SLOW_CLK (can be 150k or 32k depending on the options), max value is 0xffff.

member.name: P:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.MeasurementTime.MeasurementCycles
member.summary: The duration of the touch sensor measurement. t_meas = meas_cycle / 8M, the maximum measure time is 0xffff / 8M = 8.19 ms

member.name: F:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.FilterSettingMode.Iir4
member.summary: The filter mode is first-order IIR filter.The coefficient is 4.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.FilterSettingMode.Iir8
member.summary: The filter mode is first-order IIR filter.The coefficient is 8.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.FilterSettingMode.Iir16
member.summary: The filter mode is first-order IIR filter.The coefficient is 16 (Typical value).

member.name: F:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.FilterSettingMode.Iir32
member.summary: The filter mode is first-order IIR filter.The coefficient is 32.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.FilterSettingMode.Iir64
member.summary: The filter mode is first-order IIR filter.The coefficient is 64.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.FilterSettingMode.Iir128
member.summary: The filter mode is first-order IIR filter.The coefficient is 128.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.FilterSettingMode.Iir256
member.summary: The filter mode is first-order IIR filter.The coefficient is 256.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.FilterSettingMode.IirJitter
member.summary: The filter mode is jitter filter

member.name: T:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.TouchPadValueChangedEventHandler
member.summary: Delegate function for the event handler.
member.param: The sender .
The touch arguments.

member.name: P:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.S2S3FilterSetting.JitterSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the jitter speed size, values from 0 to 15.
member.exception: The value must be between 0 and 15.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.TouchChargeSpeed.ChargeSpeed.Zero
member.summary: No charge, values will always be zero.

member.name: T:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.TouchHighVoltage
member.summary: Voltage for the high charging point.

member.name: T:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.TouchLowVoltage
member.summary: Voltage for the low charging point.

member.name: T:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.TouchPad
member.summary: The touch pad. Some of the configurations are specific for each touch pad. Some are applied to all the touch pad like filtering, voltage and the capture mode.

member.name: M:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.TouchPad.GetGpioNumberFromTouchNumber(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the gpio number associated to a specific Touch Pad. Those are different depeending on the ESP32. Touch is available on ESP32 and ESP32-S2. Pins are different depending on the board used.
member.param: The number of touch pad to get the GPIO. For 0 to 9 for ESP32, from 0 to 14 for ESP32-S2.

member.name: P:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.TouchPad.TouchTriggerMode
member.summary: The trigger mode is the same for **ALL** the touch pads. Chaning this value will change the behavior for all of them. The default vaue is bellow the threshold. This is the normal pattern. Values when not touched are high and low when touched.

member.name: P:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.TouchPad.WakeUpSource
member.summary: The wakeup source mode is the same for **ALL** the touch pads. Chaning this value will change the behavior for all of them. By default, you need 2 different sources to be touched to wake the board. You can adjut for only one.

member.name: P:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.TouchPad.MeasurementMode
member.summary: The measurement mode mode is the same for **ALL** the touch pads. Chaning this value will change the behavior for all of them. The default measurement mode is software, meaning you have to manually request a value to get it and also to potentially have the events. The timer value will automatically read in the background all the values and generates the touched events.

member.name: M:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.TouchPad.SetVoltage(nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.TouchHighVoltage,nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.TouchLowVoltage,nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.TouchHighVoltageAttenuation)
member.summary: Sets the different voltage for operation. This is the same for **ALL** the touch pads. Chaning this value will change the behavior for all of them. The voltage parameters affect the system's stability and sensitivity. The greater the voltage threshold range, the stronger the anti-interference ability of the system, and the smaller the pulse count value. The voltage parameters (refh = 2.7V, refl = 0.5V, atten = 1V) suit most designs.
member.param: The high voltage.
The low voltage.
The attenuation.

member.name: M:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.TouchPad.StartFilter(nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.IFilterSetting)
member.summary: Starts a filtering on a specific period. This is the same for **ALL** the touch pads. Chaning this value will change the behavior for all of them. Warning: this consume CPU and should be used carefully.
member.param: The depending on your ESP32 series. ESP32 and ESP32-S2/S3 have different settings.

member.name: M:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.TouchPad.StopFilter
member.summary: Stops the filtering. This is the same for **ALL** the touch pads. Chaning this value will change the behavior for all of them.

member.name: P:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.TouchPad.IsFilterOn
member.summary: Gets if the filtering is running.

member.name: M:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.TouchPad.GetMeasurementTime
member.summary: Gets the measurement time settings. This is the same for **ALL** the touch pads. Chaning this value will change the behavior for all of them.

member.name: M:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.TouchPad.SetMeasurementTime(nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.MeasurementTime)
member.summary: Sets the measurement time settings. This is the same for **ALL** the touch pads. Chaning this value will change the behavior for all of them.
member.param: The settings.
member.exception: The measurement cycle should be less than 8.19 milliseconds

member.name: M:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.TouchPad.SetDenoise(nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.DenoiseSetting)
member.summary: Sets denoise. This is available only for ESP32-S2 and ESP32-S3.
member.param: The .

member.name: M:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.TouchPad.GetDenoise
member.summary: Gets denoise. This is available only for ESP32-S2 and ESP32-S3.

member.name: P:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.TouchPad.DenoiseEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets the denoise enabled. This is available only for ESP32-S2 and ESP32-S3.

member.name: M:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.TouchPad.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.param: A valid touch pad number.
member.remarks: Use the to get the associated GPIO of a touch pad.

member.name: M:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.TouchPad.Read
member.summary: Reads a value. This is accessible regardless of the mode used.

member.name: P:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.TouchPad.CalibrationData
member.summary: Gets the calibration data which can be used as a reference point.

member.name: M:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.TouchPad.GetCalibrationData(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the calibration data which can be used as a reference point.
member.param: The number of read you want to do. If you have a signal that varies a lot, you may want to run more than the default one.

member.name: P:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.TouchPad.Threshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the threshold used to detect a touch. Using a value of 2/3 of the calibration data is a good estimation to start with for ESP32. Using a value of x 1.3 of the calibration data is a good estimation to start with for S2/S3. This will depends of the surface you have as touch point. To understand the best value, you should read values to find the lower point.

member.name: M:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.TouchPad.SetChargeSpeed(nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.TouchChargeSpeed)
member.summary: Sets the charge speed and initial charge. High charge/discharge speed increases the system's anti-interference ability. Therefore, TouchChargeSpeed.Fastest is recommended.
member.param: The configuration.

member.name: E:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.TouchPad.ValueChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the value of the touch pad changes. this happens when the touch pad is touched or released.

member.summary: Handles internal events and re-dispatches them to the publicly subscribed delegates.
member.param: Tur if touched, false if not, so if it's been released.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.TouchPadEvent.Touched
member.summary: True if touched, false is not, so if released.

True if touched, false is not, so if released.

member.name: P:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.TouchPadEventArgs.Touched
member.summary: Gets the touch state. True if touched, false is not, so if released.

member.name: T:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.TouchPadEventHandler
member.summary: Event handler to redistribute the coming internal events.

member.name: F:nanoFramework.Hardware.Esp32.Touch.TouchTriggerMode.BellowThreshold
member.summary: Bellow threshold which is the default value.

member.name: T:System.Device.Gpio.GpioPulseCount
member.summary: Represents a near-simultaneous sampling of the number of times a pin has changed value, and the time at which this count was sampled. This structure can be used to determine the number of pin value changes over a period of time.

member.name: F:System.Device.Gpio.GpioPulseCount.Count
member.summary: The number of times the transition of polarity specified by occured on the pin.

member.name: F:System.Device.Gpio.GpioPulseCount.RelativeTime
member.summary: The time at which this count was sampled. The time is sampled close to (but not simultaneously with) the count. This timestamp can be used to determine the elapsed time between two GpioChangeCount records. It does not correspond to any absolute or system time.

member.name: T:System.Device.Gpio.GpioPulsePolarity
member.summary: Represents the polarity of changes that are relevant to the associated action.

member.name: F:System.Device.Gpio.GpioPulsePolarity.Both
member.summary: Transitions from both low to high and high to low should trigger the associated action.

member.name: F:System.Device.Gpio.GpioPulsePolarity.Falling
member.summary: Transitions from high to low should trigger the associated action.

member.name: F:System.Device.Gpio.GpioPulsePolarity.Rising
member.summary: Transitions from low to high should trigger the associated action.

member.name: T:System.Device.Gpio.GpioPulseCounter
member.summary: Counts changes of a specified polarity on a general-purpose I/O (GPIO) pin.

remarks.para: When the pin is an input, interrupts are used to detect pin changes unless the MCU supports a counter in hardware. Changes of the pin are enabled for the specified polarity, and the count is incremented when a change occurs.

When the pin is an output, the count will increment whenever the specified transition occurs on the pin. For example, if the pin is configured as an output and counting is enabled for rising edges, writing a 0 and then a 1 will cause the count to be incremented.

member.name: M:System.Device.Gpio.GpioPulseCounter.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class associated with the specified pin. Only a single may be associated with a pin at any given time.
member.param: The first pin on which to count changes.
The second pin which can be used to control how the count are done on the first pin. If no use, leave at at -1.
member.exception: TThe pin is already associated with a change counter.That change counter must be disposed before the pin can be associated with a new change counter.

member.name: P:System.Device.Gpio.GpioPulseCounter.IsStarted
member.summary: Gets whether pin change counting is currently active.
member.returns: TRUE if this pin change counting is active and FALSE otherwise.

member.name: P:System.Device.Gpio.GpioPulseCounter.Polarity
member.summary: Gets or sets the polarity of transitions that will be counted. The polarity may only be changed when pin counting is not started.

remarks.para: The default polarity value is Falling. See for more information on polarity values. Counting a single edge can be considerably more efficient than counting both edges.

member.exception: Change counting is currently active. Polarity can only be set before calling Start() or after calling Stop().

member.name: P:System.Device.Gpio.GpioPulseCounter.FilterPulses
member.summary: Gets or sets the signal filter value in microseconds. The filter value may only be changed when pin counting is not started. Valid values from 0 to 1023. The clock used is 80 MHz, filter is a multiple of the period of the clock.

member.name: M:System.Device.Gpio.GpioPulseCounter.Read
member.summary: Reads the current count of polarity changes. Before counting has been started, this will return 0.
member.returns: A structure containing a count and an associated timestamp.
member.exception: The change counter or the associated pin has been disposed.

member.name: M:System.Device.Gpio.GpioPulseCounter.Reset
member.summary: Resets the count to 0 and returns the previous count.
member.returns: A structure containing a count and an associated timestamp.
member.exception: The change counter or the associated pin has been disposed.

member.name: M:System.Device.Gpio.GpioPulseCounter.Start
member.summary: Starts counting changes in pin polarity. This method may only be called when change counting is not already active.

remarks.para: Calling Start() may enable or reconfigure interrupts for the pin.
The following exceptions can be thrown by this method:

member.exception: The change counter or the associated pin has been disposed.
Change counting has already been started.

member.name: M:System.Device.Gpio.GpioPulseCounter.Stop
member.summary: Stop counting changes in pin polarity. This method may only be called when change counting is currently active.

remarks.para: Calling Stop() may enable or reconfigure interrupts for the pin.
The following exceptions can be thrown by this method:

member.exception: The change counter or the associated pin has been disposed.
Change counting has not been started.

member.name: M:System.Device.Gpio.GpioPulseCounter.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.
